name: Evaluate
description: The evaluate operation requests clinical decision support guidance based on a specific decision support module

parameter.name: requestId
parameter.documentation: An optional client-provided identifier to track the request.

parameter.name: evaluateAtDateTime
parameter.documentation: An optional date and time specifying that the evaluation should be performed as though it was the given date and time. The most direct implication of this is that references to "Now" within the evaluation logic of the module should result in this value. In addition, wherever possible, the data accessed by the module should appear as though it was accessed at this time. The evaluateAtDateTime value may be any time in the past or future, enabling both retrospective and prospective scenarios. If no value is provided, the date and time of the request is assumed.

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.documentation: The input parameters for a request, if any. These parameters are defined by the module that is the target of the evaluation, and typically supply patient-independent information to the module.

parameter.name: inputData
parameter.documentation: The input data for the request. These data are defined by the data requirements of the module and typically provide patient-dependent information.

parameter.name: patient
parameter.documentation: The patient in context, if any.

parameter.name: encounter
parameter.documentation: The encounter in context, if any.

parameter.name: userType
parameter.documentation: The type of user initiating the request, e.g. patient, healthcare provider, or specific type of healthcare provider (physician, nurse, etc.).

parameter.name: userLanguage
parameter.documentation: Preferred language of the person using the system.

parameter.name: userTaskContext
parameter.documentation: The task the system user is performing, e.g. laboratory results review, medication list review, etc. This information can be used to tailor decision support outputs, such as recommended information resources.

parameter.name: receivingOrganization
parameter.documentation: The organization that will receive the response.

parameter.name: receivingPerson
parameter.documentation: The person in the receiving organization that will receive the response.

parameter.name: recipientType
parameter.documentation: The type of individual that will consume the response content. This may be different from the requesting user type (e.g. if a clinician is getting disease management guidance for provision to a patient). E.g. patient, healthcare provider or specific type of healthcare provider (physician, nurse, etc.).

parameter.name: recipientLanguage
parameter.documentation: Preferred language of the person that will consume the content.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.documentation: The current setting of the request (inpatient, outpatient, etc).

parameter.name: settingContext
parameter.documentation: Additional detail about the setting of the request, if any.

parameter.name: return
parameter.documentation: The result of the request as a GuidanceResponse resource.
